title: The Australian plague locust
creator_credit: Department of Agriculture Film Unit, Howard Hughes and Broken Hill Proprietary Company
brief_description: The Australian Plague Locust, unique to Australia, is one of the major pests which attack crops, particularly in New South Wales, Victoria and South Australia. Discusses the characteristics of the locust, the reasons for plagues, and the efforts to predict and control outbreaks.
creator_credit_for_label: Department of Agriculture Film Unit, Howard Hughes and Broken Hill Proprietary Company
